snippet: Mr. Epstein was a Joyce scholar for most of his life, but he touched more readers with his decision to reprint a British book called “Lord of the Flies” as a paperback in the United States.
abstract: Edmund L Epstein, a literary scholar who, as a book editor in the late 1950s, revived William Golding's novel Lord of the Flies, dies at age 80.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Epstein was a Joyce scholar for most of his life, but he touched more readers with his decision to reprint a British book called “Lord of the Flies” as a paperback in the United States.

headline.seo: Edmund Epstein Dies at 80; Gave ‘Lord of the Flies’ Wings
headline.main: Edmund L. Epstein, Scholar Who Saved ‘Lord of the Flies,’ Dies at 80
headline.print_headline: Edmund Epstein, 80, Scholar Who Saved ‘Lord of the Flies’
